phyloformer package#

Submodules#

phyloformer.attentions module#

The attentions module contains classes for the MultiHeadAttention modules in the Phyloformer network

class phyloformer.attentions.KernelAxialMultiAttention(h_dim, n_heads, dropout=0.0, eps=1e-06, n=None, k=None)[source]#

Bases: Module

Initializes internal Module state, shared by both nn.Module and ScriptModule.

forward(x)[source]#

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

training: bool#

phyloformer.data module#

The data module contains functions that are used to load alignment data in a format that the Phyloformer network understands.

class phyloformer.data.TensorDataset(directory: str, filter: List[str] | None = None)[source]#

Bases: Dataset

A Dataset class to train Phyloformer networks

Instanciates a TensorDataset

Parameters:

  • directory (str) – Path to the directory containing .tensor_pair files generated by the make_tensors script.

  • filter (List[str], optional) – List of tensor pair names to keep (useful if you keep training and validation tensors in the same directory), default is None

Returns:

A instance of TensorDataset for training phyloformer

Return type:

TensorDataset

phyloformer.data.load_alignment(path: str) → Tuple[Tensor, List[str]][source]#

Loads an alignment into a tensor digestible by the Phyloformer network

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to a fasta file containing the alignment

Returns:

a tuple containing:

  • a tensor representing the alignment (shape 22 * seq_len * n_seq)

  • a list of ids of the sequences in the alignment

Return type:

Tuple[torch.Tensor, List[str]]

phyloformer.data.load_dataset(path: str) → List[Tensor][source]#
phyloformer.data.load_tree(path: str) → Tuple[Tensor, List[Tuple[str, str]]][source]#

Loads a tree as a tensor of pairwise distances, digestible by the Phyloformer network

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to the newick file containing the tree

Returns:

a tuple containing:

  • a tensor representing the distance matrix of the tree (shape 1*n_pairs)

  • a list of tuples of ids indicating between which leafs the distance was computed

Return type:

Tuple[torch.Tensor, List[Tuple[str, str]]]

phyloformer.data.write_dm(dm: DistanceMatrix, path: str)[source]#

Write a distance matrix to disk in the square Phylip matrix format

Parameters:

  • dm (skbio.DistanceMatrix) – Distance matrix to save

  • path (str) – Path where to save the matrix

phyloformer.phyloformer module#

The phyloformer module contains the Phyloformer network as well as functions to create and load instances of the network from disk

class phyloformer.phyloformer.AttentionNet(n_blocks: int = 1, n_heads: int = 4, h_dim: int = 64, dropout: float = 0.0, device: str = 'cpu', n_seqs: int = 20, seq_len: int = 200, **kwargs)[source]#

Bases: Module

Phyloformer Network

Initializes internal Module state

Parameters:

  • n_blocks (int, optional) – Number of blocks in transformer, by default 1

  • n_heads (int, optional) – Number of heads in multi-head attention, by default 4

  • h_dim (int, optional) – Hidden dimension, by default 64

  • dropout (float, optional) – Droupout rate, by default 0.0

  • device (str, optional) – Device for model (“cuda” or “cpu”), by default “cpu”

  • n_seqs (int, optional) – Number of sequences in input alignments, by default 20

  • seq_len (int, optional) – Length of sequences in input alignment, by default 200

Returns:

Functional instance of AttentionNet for inference/fine-tuning

Return type:

AttentionNet

Raises:

ValueError – If h_dim is not divisible by n_heads

forward(x: Tensor) → Tensor[source]#

Doed a forward pass through the Phyloformer network

Parameters:

x (torch.Tensor) – Input tensor (shape 1*22*n_seqs*seq_len)

Returns:

Output tensor (shape 1*n_pairs)

Return type:

torch.Tensor

Raises:

ValueError – If the tensors aren’t the right shape

infer_dm(X: Tensor, ids: list[str] | None = None) → DistanceMatrix[source]#

Infers a phylogenetic distance matrix from embedded alignment tensor

Parameters:

  • X (torch.Tensor) – Input alignment, embedded as a tensor (shape 22*n_seq*seq_len)

  • ids (list[str], optional) – Identifiers of the sequences in the input tensor, by default None

Returns:

Phylolgenetic distance matrix inferred by Phyloformer

Return type:

skbio.DistanceMatrix

Raises:

ValueError – If the tensors aren’t the right shape

infer_tree(X: Tensor, ids: list[str] | None = None, dm: DistanceMatrix | None = None) → TreeNode[source]#

Infers a phylogenetic tree from an embedded alignment tensor

Parameters:

  • X (torch.Tensor) – Input alignment, embedded as a tensor (shape 22*n_seq*seq_len)

  • ids (list[str], optional) – Identifiers of the sequences in the input tensor, by default None

  • dm (skbio.DistanceMatrix, optional) – Precomputed distance matrix if you have already run AttentionNet.infer_dm on your own, by default None

Returns:

Phylogenetic tree computed with neighbour joining from the distance matrix inferred by Phyloformer

Return type:

Tree

Raises:

ValueError – If the tensors aren’t the right shape

save(path: str) → None[source]#

Saves the model parameters to disk

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to save the model to

training: bool#
phyloformer.phyloformer.load_model(path: str, single_gpu: bool = True) → AttentionNet[source]#

Load a Phyloformer istance froms disk

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path to model saved with AttentionNet.save()

  • single_gpu (bool, optional) – Wether inference/fine-tuning will be done on a single GPU, by default True

Returns:

Functional instance of AttentionNet for inference/fine-tuning

Return type:

AttentionNet

Raises:

ValueError – If the file does not contain the state_dict and model architecture parameters

phyloformer.phyloformer.load_state_dict(model_path: str, n_blocks: int = 6, h_dim: int = 64, n_heads: int = 4, n_seqs: int = 20, seq_len: int = 200, device: str = 'cpu', dropout: float = 0.0, single_gpu=True, **kwargs) → AttentionNet[source]#

This function loads a pre-trained phyloformer model to be used for inference or fine-tuning, from a file containing the state dict. The user must specify the model’s arrchitecture parameters themselves. For models saved with AttentionNet.save you should use the load_model function instead.

Parameters:

  • model_path (str) – Path to the saved model (Either the saved state dict or a dictionnary containing the state dict)

  • n_blocks (int, optional) – Number of attention blocks, by default 6

  • h_dim (int, optional) – Hidden dimension of attention blocks, by default 64

  • n_heads (int, optional) – Number of attentions heads per block, by default 4

  • n_seqs (int, optional) – Number of sequences in input alignments, by default 20

  • seq_len (int, optional) – Length of sequences in input alignments, by default 200

  • device (str, optional) – PyTorch device, by default “cpu”

  • dropout (float, optional) – Drop out rate, by default 0.0

  • single_gpu (bool, optional) – Wether inference/fine-tuning will be done on a single GPU, by default True

Returns:

A functional instance of AttentionNet ready for use for inference/fine-tuning

Return type:

AttentionNet

phyloformer.pretrained module#

The pretrained module contains functions to load functional pre-trainde instances of the Phyloformer model.

phyloformer.pretrained.evosimz() → AttentionNet[source]#

Loads a pre-trained Phyloformer model. This model was trained on Evosimz simulations

Returns:

A pre-trained instance of Phyloformer

Return type:

AttentionNet

phyloformer.pretrained.seqgen() → AttentionNet[source]#

Loads a pre-trained Phyloformer model. This model was trained on Seq-Gen simulations

Returns:

A pre-trained instance of Phyloformer

Return type:

AttentionNet

phyloformer.training module#

The training submodule contains necessary functions to train a Phyloformer network

phyloformer.training.init_training(model: AttentionNet, optimizer: str = 'Adam', learning_rate: float = 1e-05, loss: str = 'L2', warmup: bool = False, warmup_steps: int = 20, **kwargs) → Tuple[Optimizer, _LRScheduler | ReduceLROnPlateau, _Loss][source]#

Creates and returns an optimizer, learning rate scheduler and loss function from a config dict

Parameters:

  • model (AttentionNet) – Phyloformer model to train

  • optimizer (str, optional) – Optimization algorithm (“Adam”, “AdamW”, or “SGD”), by default “Adam”

  • learning_rate (float, optional) – Learning rate to apply, by default 1e-5

  • loss (str, optional) – Loss function (choices “L1” or “L2”), by default “L2”

  • warmup (bool, optional) – Wether to do learning rate warmupt, by default False

  • warmup_steps (int, optional) – Number of warmup steps, by default 20

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The optimizer

  • The learning rate scheduler

  • The loss function

Return type:

Tuple[torch.optim.Optimizer,Scheduler,torch.nn.modules.loss._Loss]

phyloformer.training.load_checkpoint(path: str, device: str = 'cpu') → Tuple[AttentionNet, Optimizer, _LRScheduler | ReduceLROnPlateau, _Loss, Dict[str, Any]][source]#

Loads a model training checkpoint from disk

Parameters:

  • path (str) – Path to the saved checkpoint

  • device (str, optional) – Device to load the model onto (“cpu” or “cuda”), by default “cpu”

Returns:

A tuple containing:

  • The model

  • The optimizer

  • The learning rate scheduler

  • The loss function

  • The training configuration

Return type:

Tuple[ AttentionNet, torch.optim.Optimizer, Scheduler, torch.nn.modules.loss._Loss, Dict[str, Any]]

phyloformer.training.save_checkpoint(model: AttentionNet, optimizer: Optimizer, scheduler: _LRScheduler | ReduceLROnPlateau, config: Dict[str, Any], path: str)[source]#

Saves a checkpoint of the current training process

Parameters:

  • model (AttentionNet) – Model to save

  • optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer) – Optimizer to save

  • scheduler (Scheduler) – Learning rate scheduler to save

  • config (Dict[str, Any]) – Config with which training was started

  • path (str) – Path to save the checkpoint to

phyloformer.training.training_loop(model: AttentionNet, optimizer: Optimizer, scheduler: _LRScheduler | ReduceLROnPlateau, criterion: _Loss, train_data: DataLoader, val_data: DataLoader, device: str = 'cpu', epochs: int = 80, amp: bool = True, clip_gradients: bool = True, early_stopping: bool = False, stopping_steps: int = 8, best_path: str | None = None, checkpoint_path: str | None = None, log_file: str | None = None, tensorboard_writer: Any | None = None, config: Dict[str, Any] = {}, **kwargs) → Tuple[AttentionNet, int][source]#

Trains a Phyloformer model

Parameters:

  • model (AttentionNet) – model instance to train

  • optimizer (torch.optim.Optimizer) – Optimizer for training

  • scheduler (Scheduler) – Learning rate scheduler

  • criterion (torch.nn.modules.loss._Loss) – Loss function

  • train_data (DataLoader) – Training data

  • val_data (DataLoader) – Validation data

  • device (str, optional) – Device on which to train (“cpu” or “cuda”), by default “cpu”

  • epochs (int, optional) – Number of epochs to train the model for, by default 80

  • amp (bool, optional) – Use automatic mixed precision (only available on “cuda” device), by default True

  • clip_gradients (bool, optional) – Wether to clip gradients during training, by default True

  • early_stopping (bool, optional) – Wether to stop trainig early if there is no improvement of validation loss , by default False

  • stopping_steps (int, optional) – After how many stesp without improvement to stop training early, by default 8

  • best_path (Optional[str], optional) – Path to save the best checkpoint so fat, by default None

  • checkpoint_path (Optional[str], optional) – Path to save the last checkpoint, by default None

  • log_file (Optional[str], optional) – Path to the log file to write training metrics, by default None

  • tensorboard_writer (Optional[Any], optional) – SummaryWriter for following training on tensorboard, by default None

  • config (Dict[str, Any], optional) – Config dictionary (saved in checkpoints), by default dict()

Returns:

a tuple containing:

  • The model with the best validation loss

  • The epoch at which this function returns

Return type:

Tuple[AttentionNet, int]
